name: CreateStatusPageSubscription
description:
Subscribe to a status page by ID.

Use this tool to create a subscription for a specific status page using its ID. Requires appropriate OAuth permissions.

parameters.name: status_page_id
parameters.description: The ID of the status page to subscribe to. This string is used to identify the specific page.

parameters.name: accept_header_versioning
parameters.description: Specify the Accept header for API versioning when creating a status page subscription.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: status_page_subscription_request
parameters.description: JSON object containing subscription details: channel, contact, status page ID and type, subscribable object ID and type. Used to create a status page subscription.

contact.description: The subscriber's contact - email address or webhook URL.

id.description: The id of the status page.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

id.description: The ID of the subscribed entity for a given subscription.

type.description: The type of the subscribed entity for a given subscription.

subscribable_object.description: The subscribed entity for a given subscription.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

subscription.description: Request schema for creating a StatusPageSubscription.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

contact.description: The subscriber's contact - email address or webhook URL.

id.description: The id of the status page.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

id.description: The ID of the subscribed entity for a given subscription.

type.description: The type of the subscribed entity for a given subscription.

subscribable_object.description: The subscribed entity for a given subscription.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

subscription.description: Request schema for creating a StatusPageSubscription.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
